The monthly charge is based on the data tier subscriber reached in the month. Each mont subscriber's plan automatically resets to the basic data tier. All possible values will be defined in reference ods and service will do validation against the values defined in reference ods.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="bureauReportStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>correspond to credit asmt status with values Active, Void.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="creditAssessmentVoidReasonCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All possible values will be defined in reference ods and service will do validation against the values defined in reference ods.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="creditProfileFormatCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Format of credit profile in the Credit Management PDS. Possible values are: "P" - Person, "O" - Organization. Default format - "P" (Person). All possible values will be defined in reference ods and service will do validation against the values defined in reference ods.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="creditProfileMethodCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Method of creation of Credit Profile in the Credit Management PDS. All possible values will be defined in reference ods and service will do validation against the values defined in reference ods.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="creditCheckConsentCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Credit check consent code. All possible values will be defined in reference ods and service will do validation against the values defined in reference ods.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="residencyCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Residency code. Examples: P- Person, O- Orgaization, U- Unknown</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="civicNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The official number assigned to an address by the municipality. EXAMPLES: 2514</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="civicNumberSuffixType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Typically an alpha or fractional suffix to a civic number e.g. "A" or "1/2" appended after the civic number.EXAMPLES:B, 2 (for 1/2), etc.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ruralRouteNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The number used to identify a rural route. Must be combined with the rural route code to create a valid address element. EXAMPLES: "8"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ruralRouteTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code used to represent a Rural Route designator. EXAMPLES: RR - Rural Route, SS - Suburban Service, MR - Mobile Route, GD - General Delivery. RefPDS; RURAL_ROUTE_TYP_CUSTPF</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="stationAreaNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the village, town, city, or metropolitan area which forms part of the Canada Post station name. EXAMPLES: MISSION, MEDICINE HAT, SURREY, WINNIPEG. COMMENTS: Must be combined with the station type code to create a valid address element.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="stationQualifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name used to identify a Canada Post Station Qualifier. Must be used in conjuction with a Station Area Name. EXAMPLES: A, MAIN</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="stationTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The abbreviation used to identify a type of Canada Post Station. EXAMPLES: STN - Station, RPO - Retail Postal Outlet. RefPDS- STATION_TYPE_CA_POST</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="additionalAddressInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Optional data that a mailer wishes to include or Non-fielded address information. Typically used for USA or International Address. Types that are not validated more specifically than State and Country respectively. EXAMPLES: SITE/ COMPARTMENT 3, LOT/CONCESSION 45.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="renderedAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The first line of the rendered address. EXAMPLES: 201 - 2514B Acacia Dr</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="addrAssgnmtIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Automatically generated number to uniquely identify the Address Assignment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="addressAssignmentSubTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies the type of the entity to address relationship denoting the use of the given address (As specified by the addr_id attribute).EXAMPLES: M: Mailing Billing Address (Billing Account) T: Billing Tax Address (Billing Account) E: Billing Email Address (Billing Account) N - Primary Contact Address (Contact Indivdual) C - Customer Official Address (Customer) S - Service Address (Service Instance) D - Default Billing Address (Customer) : Used for populating a default addresses to the user interface for CSRs ease of use. This could be changed by CSRs. Introduced as part of SDSE. RefPDS: ADDR_ASGNMT_TYPE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="addressAssignmentTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Further classification of the address assignment type, e.g. original, standardized. EXAMPLES: O - original (default) C - cleansed (output from Trillium) P - parsed (output from Trillium)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="addressMatchingStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Description: A code signifying an address validation status. Example: V; I; C; N. V- Verifiable, C- Correctable, N- Not correctable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="addressSearchTextType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="canadaPostBuildNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Name of building as obtained from canada post directories. TD Tower, Telus building etc..</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="canadaPostLocnNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the organization at the address. TELUS Communications ( for 3777 kingsway) . This value is taken from Canada post directories and filled with the trillium output for business customers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="canadaPostRecordTypeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The record type(classification) information as given by trillium based on canada post directory. Note : This has no direct relation or meaning as the 'address type'. This field may be useful in determining the type of the record in telus.
This field is available from the Canada Post Directories and define the address type for a given address or addresses. For example, for 3777 Kingsway, the address type is B for Large Volume Receiver.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="careOfType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Optional data that a mailer wishes to include indicating the identity of a party able to take temporary custody of the mail in order to pass it on to the addressee. EXAMPLE: c/o John Smith; c/o Best Western Hotel</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="countryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code used to represent a country following the ISO 3166 (Alpha3) standard. EXAMPLES: CAN, USA. RefPDS- COUNTRY_OVERSEAS</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="emailAddressTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains the email address or the website URL.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="externalAddressIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifier for an address that is unique in the source system. Must be used in conjunction with Address Source System identifier to be unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="externalAddressSourceIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Source System Identifier for the external address</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="externalServiceAddressIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Source System Identifier for the external service address (e.g. FMS address id)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="fleetMailOfficeNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The city in which the fleet mail office for the ship in question resides (currently either Halifax or Victoria) EXAMPLES: Halifax</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="hmcsNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the relevant Canadian forces ship to be used within a military address. EXAMPLES: Chicoutimi</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="mailingTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code to represent mailability. EXAMPLES: M, E RefPDS- MAILG_TYP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="municipalityNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The official municipality name, as provided to Canada Post. Should not be translated. (E.G.: TROIS-RIVIES is not THREE RIVERS.) EXAMPLES: Burnaby</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="postOfficeBoxNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The assigned number of the post office box. The # symbol must not be used, nor the French equivalent no. Punctuation should not be used. EXAMPLES: 97</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="postalZipCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The code assigned by the Canadian or US Postal Service to the postal district. For Canadian Postal Codes may be 6 characters. For US Zip codes - It may be either five or nine digits. If the nine-digit format is used, a hyphen will be used to separate the fifth and sixth digits. (This hyphen is not stored in the database) EXAMPLES: V2H 7T4</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="provinceStateCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The accepted ISO 3166-2, two character code of a state, territory or possession of Canada or the USA. RefPDS- PROVINCE_STATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="relateAddressAssignmentIdType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="streetDirectionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The code used to represent one of the eight principle compass directions. EXAMPLES: E- East, N- North, NE- Northeast, NW- Northwest (English), NO- Northwest (French), S- South, SE- Southeast, SW- Southwest (English), SO- Southwest (French), W- West (English), O- West (French). RefPDS- STREET_DIR_CA_POST</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="streetNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The official name recognized by each municipality. This name should not be translated. (E.G.: "Main" is not translatable to "Principale".)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="streetTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code to represent a Street Type. EXAMPLES: ST, RD, BLVD, CRES. RefPDS- STREET_TYP_CA_POST</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="unitNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Typically a suite or apartment within the main building identified by the rest of the address. EXAMPLES: 201</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="unitTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of unit number as defined by canada post. EXAMPLES: Unit, Suite</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="unitTypeDwellingType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="validateAddressIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether the address should undergo validation EXAMPLES: ("Y") or not ("N")</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="firstNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>First/Given name of an individual</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="fullNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This is the full name of an individual or organization. It is made up of a base and an optional supplementary components. The base name is either a "person name" or an "organization name". The supplementary portion is made up of a "supplementary name formatting keyword code" and "supplementary name". A "person name" is made up of first name, middle name and last name. EXAMPLES: Residential: MARTIN WIENS, Residential: DENNIS K Y TONG, Residential: SUSANA LEO-YIM, Business: MALCA TRADING INC O/A BANANA LEAF ON DENMAN, Business: DIANA BECK D/B FAIRYLAND GIFTS, Business: GREATER VAN RENT CHEK SRVCS INC D/B 738 DIRECTORY, Business: INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT CENTRE INC, Business: DR Y VICTOR YOSHIDA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="lastNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Last/Family name of an individual</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="middleNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Middle name of an individual</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="nameAssignmentSubTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>C- Cleansed, P- Parsed, O- Original</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="nameAssignmentTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>L- Legal, A- Alias, P- Preferred, I- Additional Info</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="nameRelTextType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="nameSearchTxtType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="nameSuffixCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code representing the suffix of a name. EXAMPLES: Jr for Junior, Esq for Esquire, Sr for Senior. RefPDS: NAME_SUFFIX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="organizationNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Organization Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="relateNameAssignmentIdType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="salutationCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code representing a salutation which is a formal appellation optionally attached to the name of a person or family by virtue of office, rank, hereditary privilege, noble birth, or attainment or used as a mark of respect. EXAMPLES: Dr. Miss Mr. Mrs. Ms. Colonel RefPDS- BI_CM_SALUTATION_CODE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="supplementaryNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The extended customer name such as trade name for the sole proprietorship business customer. It is the trade/firm name that followed the operating type such as Operating As (O/A), Doing Business as (D/B). EXAMPLES: The full name "MALCA TRADING INC O/A BANANA LEAF ON DENMAN" is composed of an organization name "MALCA TRADING INC", supplementary name formatting key word of "O/A" and supplementary name of "BANANA LEAF ON DENMAN"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="supplementaryNameOperatingCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code representing the formatting key word for the supplementary name. EXAMPLES: O/A for Operating As D/B for Doing Business as
COMMENTS: The full name "MALCA TRADING INC O/A BANANA LEAF ON DENMAN" is composed of an organization name "MALCA TRADING INC", supplementary name formatting key word of "O/A" and supplementary name of "BANANA LEAF ON DENMAN". RefPDS- BI_CM_SUPPLEMENTARY_NAME_OPERATING_CODE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="customerMarketSegmentId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An automatically generated unique identifier for customer market segment</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="customerMarketSegmentCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The market segment code associated to the Customer for the specified market segment type. RefPDS- MKT_SEG_A</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="customerMarketSegmentTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code indicating the type of scheme of categorization used for Customer Market Segmentation. EXAMPLES: CBU- CBU Code, SS1- CBU segment A, SS2- CBU segment B, VALS- Customer Value segment. RefPDS- MKT_SEG_TYPE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountNumberCheckDigitNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Derived based on the billing account number.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountOpenDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creation date of the Billing Account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code indicating the status of the account. When a new billing account is created, the status is Tentative. When charges are distributed to the billing account, the status is Open. When no effective charges are distributed to the billing account, the status is Cancelled. EXAMPLES: O- Open, C- Cancelled. RefODS- BI_PAY_BILLING_ACCOUNT_STATUS</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountStatusDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>date of the latest billing account status change</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="defaultBillCycleCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The default bill-cycle associated with the customer. New billing accounts should use this cycle code unless another is requested.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="defaultNewBillCycleCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The default new bill-cycle associated with the customer. This is set during a change of bill cycle that is the new default.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billCycleCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code representing the date of billing for a billing account</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="newBillCycleCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code representing the date of billing for a billing account. Used for changes in billing cycle date</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billCycleFrequencyCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The bill cycle frequency. EXAMPLES: W - Week, M - Month. RefODS- BILL_CYCLE_FREQUENCY_CODE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountCurrentBalanceAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The billing account balance is calculated based on the last bill due amount and the AR transactions (payments and credit adjustments) post last bill.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billInsertSuppressionIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether a bill insert will be included with the Bill.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectAddressTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The address the bill document will be redirected to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billReturnEnvelopeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>It will have one of four possible values: N - never send an envelope, A - always send envelope, S - send envelope, H - hold sending envelope. RefPDS: BI_CM_BILL_RETURN_ENVELOPE_CODE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectEffectiveStartDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date at which the bill redirect becomes effective.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectEffectiveEndDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date at which the bill redirect expires.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectOperatorIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id of the operator the bill document will be redirected to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectOperatorNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the operator the bill document will be redirected to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billRedirectReasonCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reason for bill redirect. EXAMPLES: MANUAL_HOLDOUT- Manual Hold-out. RefPDS: BI_CM_BILL_REDIRECT_REASON_CODE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="lastPaymentReturnAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of the most recent returned NSF payment since last statement</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="lastPaymentReturnDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Date of the most recent returned NSF payment</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="lastBillTotalDueAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount due from the most recent bill.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="lastPaymentAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment amount recorded on the most recent bill.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="paymentDueDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment due date from the most recent bill</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="paymentAmountSinceLastStatementType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount a customer has payed since the most recent bill was generated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="collectionStartDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>States the start of the collection treatment, if account is not in collection treatment - value would be NULL. This field is reset to NULL when an account is pulled out of collection treatment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="collectionEndDateType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="collectionIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>States if an account was in collection treatment at any point of time in the past. Defaults to N and is set to Y whenever the accounts starts collection treatment for the first time. (never goes back to N)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="riskIndicatorCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A indication of the likelyhood for a customer to pay his/her/its bills based on TELUS internal past experience of the customer paying bills. EXAMPLES: H1 - High Risk level 1, H2 - High Risk level 2, H3 - High Risk level 3, M4 - Medium Risk level 4, M5 - Medium Risk level 5, M6 - Medium Risk level 6, L7 - Low Risk level 7, L8 - Low Risk level 8, L9 - Low Risk level 9, NS - No Score No score BUSINESS RELATED INFORMATION: 1. Assigned to a customer based on credit score and other criteria. 2. Once Risk Indicator has been assigned to a Billing account (customer, or credit profile), a change in Bahavioral Score to range mapping will NOT result in a re-evaluation of the Risk Indicator assignments. 3. A code reflecting Behavioral Score ranges. COMMENTS: Mastered in Credit Management. RefPDS: TCM_RISK_INDICATOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="collectionFollowUpDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date until all of the collection treatments are stopped (either automatic or manual).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="collectionAgencyReferralType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="writeOffDateType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="returnDueDateType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="autoTreatmentSuppressionStartDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date when suppression of autotreatment starts.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="autoTreatmentSuppressionEndDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date when suppression of autotreatment ends.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionActiveIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A flag to indicate whether this Billing Account is active in the source system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionAssignmentStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code indicating the status of this Billing Account, with respect to its assignment to a Customer. Automatically set by the Customer Hierarchy system. This field may no longer be required.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionClassCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code indicating whether the billing account is business or residential. This field will no longer be required</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionNodeTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A code set by the Customer Hierarchy system to indicate the type of the Billing Account when considered as node in the hierarchy. This provides a perspective for assigning the Billing Account and/or its children to a Customer node. This field may be no longer required.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionRefIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Reference Identification is the account identifier used in ECH ( Enterprise Customer Hierarchy).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionDirectAssignableIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Denotes whether an account (from any system) can be directly assigned to a customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionPrimaryServiceResourceTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account sub type code from the source billing system. EXAMPLES: R - Business - Regular, Q - Corporate - PCS Enterprise, 1 - Consumer -- Mike Regular. RefPDS- BILLING_ACCOUNT_EXT_SUB_TYP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionPrimaryServiceResourceValueIdType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The primary resource is the field that is used for customer identification. It is a normal resource field that is usually used for guiding, but has a special use for customer identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionReferenceTelephoneNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Some services, such as High Speed, are provisioned upon an existing local telephone service. Where that is the case, this field provides the telephone number of the local service upon which this account is provisioned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionSubscriberCountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates number of subscribers. Used only for Wireless. Interim. May no longer be required.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionSourceAccountTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Type Code from the source billing system. EXAMPLES: B - Business, C - Corporate, I - Individual. RefPDS- BILLING_ACCOUNT_EXT_TYP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingAccountExtensionSourceAccountSubTypeCodeType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingRelationshipTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Business purpose for associating two Billing Accounts. EXAMPLES: PARENT, PAYABLE, PILOT, SIBLING, BILLCVRGENCE Bill Convergence, ACCOUNTLINK- Account Consolidation, ONEBILLCONSENT- One Bill Consent, 3- Clearnet Association, BUNDLE- Bundle Link Accounts linked for the purpose of bundling RefPDS: BILLING_ACCT_ASSN_PURPS_TYP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingRelationshipEffectiveStartDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Date the relationship becomes effective</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="billingRelationshipEffectiveEndDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Date the relationship is no longer effective</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="payChannelCategoryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies whether the pay channel is a prepaid or postpaid channel.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="paymentMethodCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This describes the choice of payment such as preauthorized, Credit Card and Direct Debit or Invoice, Check, etc.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="payChannelOpenDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Date on which the pay channel was opened.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="payChannelStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Status of Pay channel: C - CANCELLED, N - NOT_APPLICATIVE, O - OPENED, T - TENTATIVE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="payChannelStatusDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date at which the current status has changed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="preAuthorizedPaymentSystemMaxDeductionAmountType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Maximum amount deducted for Payment Method (Direct Debit/Credit Card). If the balance amount is greater than the maximum the remaining amount will be invoiced. All amounts are invoiced but the bill includes indication as to the total amount due.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:float"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="preAuthorizedPaymentSystemSuspensionIndicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether the pre-authorized payment is suspended. No list of equipment/SKU will be provided in the offer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="keepExistingPlanCode" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>0 - Offer Based - client can keep the existing price plan if it matches with his new profile, is renewal eligible, and part of the offer. 1 - Append Always - client can keep the existing price plan if it matches with his new profile, and is renewal eligible 2 - Append Never - client can keep the existing price plan if it matches with his new profile, is renewal eligible, part of the offer, and current.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="offerFinanceCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>SAP material number associated with the offer (*not* the device SKU)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentSupportTypeCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Values can be: subsidy, finance, Tab</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="tabTypeCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Values can be: 4 - Koodo simonly (No tab) 7 - koodo tab option 6 - koodo tab+ option</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="rankingNum" type="xs:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This represent the ranking of offer, where ranking 1 has higher probability to accept the offer. type="tns:pricePlanDetailURLItem" maxOccurs="10"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Offer"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="offerCode" type="poc:offerCodeType"/> <xs:element <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="offerCode" type="poc:offerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>AOM offer code for activations OR OOM offer code for upgrade/renewal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="offerDescriptionText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"/> <xs:element name="offerTypeCode" type="poc:offerTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One of the following: MIGRATION RENEWAL ACTIVATION</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="offerSubTypeCode" type="poc:offerSubTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to OOM offers only: HARDWARE NON-HARDWARE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eligibleTermList" type="tns:OfferTermList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM and OOM offers. For OOM, will map to one term.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="productBuyList" type="tns:OfferProductList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used in a Buy/Get offer redemption. List of products from which client needs to "Buy" in order to get the discount on the "Get" equipment. Only for activations.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="productGetList" type="tns:OfferProductList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The list of products eligible for discount. Used for both activation and renewal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eligiblePricePlanList" type="tns:EligiblePricePlanList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM offers only. List of eligible price plans for the selected offer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eligibleFeatureList" type="tns:EligibleServiceList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM offers only. List of features that must be seleceted for the selected offer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="minCommitment" type="poc:MinCommitment" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM offers only.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="nationalOfferIndicator" type="poc:nationalOfferIndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM offers only</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="availableAreaList" type="poc:AreaList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to AOM offers only</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="poc:effectiveDateType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="expiryDate" type="poc:expiryDateType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="eligibilityAdditionalInfo" type="poc:EligibilityAdditionalInfo" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Extra eligibility criteria that may be required for an AOM activation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="productBuyQty" type="poc:mustBuyQtyType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="productGetQty" type="poc:mustGetQtyType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="containSimIndicator" type="poc:containSimIndicatorType"/> <xs:element name="containImeiIndicator" type="poc:containImeiIndicatorType"/> <xs:element name="containEsnIndicator" type="poc:containEsnIndicatorType"/> <xs:element name="buyGetOfferIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="OfferProductList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="offerProduct" type="tns:OfferProduct" maxOccurs="1000"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If empty, then productBuyList should be returned empty.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="OfferProduct"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="productCode" type="prdt:productCodeType"/> <xs:element name="productDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"/> <xs:element name="productNetworkTypeCode" type="tns:productNetworkTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Represents equipment network type (i.e. CDMA, HSPA, etc...)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="suggestedPrice" type="prdt:priceAmtType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>MSRP of product.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="productImageLinkUrl" type="tns:productImageLinkUrlType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>URL link for additional product details.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="productFeatureList" type="tns:ProductFeatureList" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="50"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to OOM only. Lists the capabilities of the handset (i.e. GPS, etc)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="offerDiscountList" type="tns:OfferDiscount" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Optional in case OOM decides not to load discounts as part of this response. Max 10 in order to support different terms for the same product for AOM offers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ProductFeatureList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="productFeature" type="tns:productFeatureLinkUrlType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--Offer Discount type--> <xs:complexType name="OfferDiscount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="discountAmt" type="poc:offerDiscountAmtType"/> <xs:element name="discountTerm" type="poc:termType"/> <xs:element name="discountdeliveryType" type="poc:DiscountDeliveryType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>POS or Airtime</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="OfferTermList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="offerTerm" type="poc:termType" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceDetail" type="tns:ServiceDetail" maxOccurs="200"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EligibleServiceList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceDescText" type="ec:MessageType" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Service"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceCode" type="poc:serviceCodeType"/> <xs:element name="serviceDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. Messaging 30, Call Asia</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="servicePriceAmt" type="tns:servicePriceAmtType"/> <xs:element name="paymentFrequency" type="tns:paymentFrequencyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. 1 (per mth), 12 (per yr)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceTypeCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to differentiate between promotional SOCs and optional SOCs. Potential values include ('R', 'O'. 'P', 'S', etc...)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceDetail"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Can we use the logic around preselected and read-only to move that SOC into the manadatory group.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="service" type="tns:Service"/> <xs:element name="serviceMandatoryIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"/> <xs:element name="readOnlyIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Cases where pre-selected and cannot unselect. Some services are setup as optional but business rules dictacte that they must be selected. Used in conjunction with preselected indicator.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="preselectedIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Not required to be selected but used to drive the UI. E.g. international dailing SOC not required but can be preselected.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="validationParameterList" type="tns:ValidationParameterList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For front-end Service conflict checks. Items in the list are feature codes. The rule is that if a feature code is mutually exclusive then within the list of services on the contract only one feature code is allowed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="promoFeatureIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Not used for activation</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="promoExpiryDate" type="tns:promoExpiryDateType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Not used for activation</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="offerAsBonusIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Renewal</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="currentlySubscribedIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Not used for activation</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="autoRenewableIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates if the service has an automatic renew option.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mandatoryAutoRenewableIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set to TRUE if the service has an automatic renew option that should always be set.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="additionalServiceInfo" type="ec:CodeDescTextList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used for footnotes and conditional statements</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="boundServiceList" type="tns:BoundServiceList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A service can have multiple child services that are automatically added to the contract upon selection of the parent service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidationParameterList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="validationParameter" type="tns:ValidationParameterDetail" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidationParameterDetail"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="featureCode" type="poc:serviceCodeType"/> <xs:element name="mutuallyExclusiveIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceParameterList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceParameter" type="tns:serviceParameterType" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PricePlanList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlan" type="tns:PricePlan" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EligiblePricePlanList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlanDescText" type="ec:MessageType" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PricePlan"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlanCode" type="poc:serviceCodeType"/> <xs:element name="pricePlanDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"/> <xs:element name="pricePlanPriceAmt" type="tns:servicePriceAmtType"/> <xs:element name="pricePlanCategoryList" type="tns:PricePlanCategoryList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This will model categories for price plans (i.e. size or shareable)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pricePlanDetailURLList" type="tns:pricePlanDetailURLList" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="currentSubscribedPricePlanIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates the price plan the subscriber is currently on. Not used for new or add-on activations. If all values are FALSE then the subscribers current plan is not available.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="validTerms" type="poc:termType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Applies to Acquisitions only - 0, 12, 24, 36.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PricePlanDetail"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlan" type="tns:PricePlan"/> <xs:element name="serviceGroupList" type="tns:ServiceGroupList" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. included features, mandatory services, features bundles, optional features and services</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceGroupList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceGroup" type="tns:ServiceGroup" maxOccurs="10"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceGroup"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceGroupTypeCode" type="tns:serviceGroupTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>INCL = included features BUND = feature bundles OPT = optional MAND = mandatory</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceGroupTypeDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. included features, mandatory services, features bundles, optional features and services</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceCategoryList" type="tns:ServiceCategoryList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Represent sub categories by SOC category code. May require 'default' if no sub-categories exist.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceCategoryList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceCategory" type="tns:ServiceCategory" maxOccurs="50"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceCategory"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="serviceCategoryDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. Calling Features, Visual Voicemail, Messaging Features etc...</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceCategoryTypeCode" type="tns:serviceCategoryTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Defined in application configuration.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceList" type="tns:ServiceList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The actual services (i.e. My Surf Enterprise, Messaging 30)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mutuallyExclusiveIndicator" type="ec:indicatorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. checkboxes vs. radio buttons</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sortOrder" type="tns:sortOrderType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e sort by price, alphabetical</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PricePlanCategoryList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlanCategory" type="tns:PricePlanCategory" maxOccurs="10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>elements of this category (i.e. size, shared)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PricePlanCategory"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pricePlanCategoryDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. small plans (less than $50), large plans (greater or equal to $50), shared plans</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pricePlanCategoryTypeCode" type="tns:pricePlanCategoryTypeCodeType"/> <xs:element name="pricePlanCategoryCode" type="tns:pricePlanCategoryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>i.e. LG, SM, SHARED</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For SIM only equipment one need to define the device type. Following is the list of deviceTypes: PCS Phone, PDASmartPhone, BlackBerry Smartphone, Mobile InternetDevice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceTypeCode" type="tns:deviceTypeCodeType"/> <xs:element name="deviceTypeDescText" type="ec:CodeDescTextList"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="BoundServiceList"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="boundService" type="tns:Service" maxOccurs="20"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>
